company_context: F5 NGINX Products Deploy applications faster and with more confidence than ever before. Get to know NGINX One An Architecture for Modern Applications F5 NGINX provides a suite of products that together form the core of what organizations need to create apps and APIs with performance, reliability, security, and scale. Products Modernize apps at scale with high-performance app delivery spanning monoliths to microservices. NGINX One The core NGINX data plane software enhanced with SaaS-based tools for observability, management, and security. F5 WAF for NGINX and F5 DoS for NGINX Comprehensive WAF security and denial-of-service (DoS) defense solutions designed to protect apps and APIs from layer 7 attacks. NGINXaaS for Azure An Infrastructure-as-a-Service version of NGINX that enables you to deliver secure and high-performance apps, deployed straight from the Azure Marketplace. F5 NGINXaaS for Google Cloud Enhance app delivery and security in Google Cloud without the operational toil: Accelerate performance, strengthen protection, and improve visibility at scale, while keeping costs optimized. NGINX One Components NGINX Plus An all-in-one, cloud-native load balancer, reverse proxy, web server, content cache, and API gateway. F5 WAF for NGINX A comprehensive WAF security solution designed to protect apps and APIs from layer 7 attacks. NGINX Instance Manager Identify, secure, manage, and monitor all NGINX Open Source and NGINX Plus instances in your organization. NGINX Ingress Controller Implements unified API gateways, load balancers, and ingress controllers across Kubernetes environments and provides insights into app health and performance. NGINX Gateway Fabric Streamlines app, service, and API connectivity across hybrid and multicloud Kubernetes environments with a unified app delivery fabric. NGINX One Console Configure, secure, monitor and manage NGINX instances at scale with NGINX One management console. Awards and Recognition 2024 TrustRadius Top Rated Award Resources Featured Our design vision for NGINX One: The ultimate data plane SaaS NGINX One takes the core NGINX data plane software you're familiar with and enhances it with SaaS-based tools for observability, management, and security. Read the blog Blogs Dynamic A/B Kubernetes Multi-Cluster Load Balancing and Security Controls with NGINX Plus › The Mission-Critical Patient-Care Use Case That Became a Kubernetes Odyssey › Webinars Get Hands-On with NGINX and QUIC+HTTP/3 › Open source resources GitHub Code Repositories › NGINX Open Source › Compare NGINX One to NGINX Open Source › Related use cases Optimize, Scale, and Secure API Communications › Optimize, Scale, and Secure AI Interactions › Optimize, Scale, and Secure Cloud-Native, Modern Applications › Optimize, Scale, and Secure Apps in Kubernetes › Next Steps Contact us Find out how F5 products and solutions can enable you to achieve your goals. Contact F5 Explore packaging options Explore the best options for your organization. Explore

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Hi, is this [CTO Name]? My name is Alex from DeepData AI. I'm calling because I saw F5 NGINX's recent TrustRadius Top Rated award, and it got me thinking about how companies like yours are managing the sheer volume of data generated by modern application architectures. We help CTOs streamline their data processing pipelines to accelerate insights.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: Alex, thanks for the call. I'm swamped today. What specifically about our data processing are you concerned with? We have a pretty robust infrastructure with NGINX One and our Azure/GCP deployments.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I understand you're busy, [CTO Name]. My aim isn't to re-architect your current setup, but rather to see if there are any hidden bottlenecks or inefficiencies in how you're processing the telemetry, logs, and user data that your applications are producing. For instance, are your teams spending a lot of time on manual data preparation before they can even start extracting value?

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: "Hidden bottlenecks"? That sounds a bit vague. We use a combination of our existing logging solutions and some custom scripts. Our engineers are quite capable. Frankly, we're not looking to rip and replace anything major right now, especially with NGINX One providing a unified management layer.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I appreciate that. And it's precisely because you have NGINX One and are leveraging cloud platforms that I thought our solution might be a good fit. DeepData AI is designed to integrate *with* your existing stack, not replace it. We specifically help accelerate the analysis of large, disparate datasets by using AI to automate much of that preparatory work – think automated anomaly detection in logs or predictive insights from user behavior data without weeks of manual scripting. We've seen companies reduce their data processing time by up to 60%.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: 60% reduction? That's a bold claim. We've looked at AI-driven data solutions before, and the integration overhead and cost were prohibitive. Plus, our security team is very particular about what data gets processed and where. We already have F5 WAF and DoS for NGINX, and they're performing well.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I understand your skepticism, and we hear that often. Regarding integration, DeepData AI is designed with flexibility in mind, with connectors for common data sources and APIs that can fit into existing workflows, including those feeding into or out of your NGINX deployments. We don't require you to move all your data to a proprietary platform. And on security, our platform is built with zero-trust principles and can operate within your existing security posture. For a quick overview of how we've helped organizations similar to yours, I'd love to schedule a brief 15-minute call next week. We can demonstrate specific use cases relevant to your environment.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: Look, Alex, I appreciate the persistence, but the timing just isn't right. We're deep in a major cloud migration project right now, and introducing a new data processing tool, even with your claims of easy integration, is not a priority. We'll stick with our current tools for the foreseeable future. Thanks again for your time.

analysis.raw:
Score: 3
Outcome: Failure
Key_Objection: Timing
Feedback: The seller needs to better qualify the buyer's pain points and timing before launching into a solution pitch. Sentiment: Negative

parsed.feedback: The seller needs to better qualify the buyer's pain points and timing before launching into a solution pitch. Sentiment: Negative
